item.title: XeroLinux Plasma Install
item.description: Introduction # I want to begin by thanking everyone who has shown the Distro all the the love. Without whom it wouldn’t have lasted as long as it did. As well as the rest of the projects present and future.

item.title: The Chaotic-AUR
item.description: A bit of information # Chaotic-AUR is an unofficial package repository that contains pre-built packages from the Arch User Repository (AUR) . It is an automated building service that compiles AUR packages so users don’t have to build them themselves.

item.title: Add XeroLinux Repo
item.description: Hey there… I was recently asked if my Repo can be added to other Arch-Based Distros, short answer is yes of course you can. I will be showing you how below.

item.title: Continue to use XeroLinux
item.description: Intro # With the Distro is now gone, you have two choices, either back up your data and move on to another one. I would recommend you install Vanilla Arch using the ArchInstall script via the official Arch ISO if you want to benefit from the XeroCLI.

item.title: Chroot Guide
item.description: Info # Changing Root (Chroot) is the process of changing of the apparent disk root directory (and the current running process and its children) to another root directory. When you change root to another directory you cannot access files and commands outside that directory.

item.title: Converseen, the batch image converter
item.description: This one such a time saver.. # Converseen can do batch image conversion, apply similar alteration like rotation, resize, remove image metadata, let you ignore specific files if you import a collection.

item.title: Enable Snaps on Arch
item.description: What are Snaps ? # Snaps are a innovative packaging format for distributing applications on Linux. Developed by Canonical, snaps are self-contained software bundles that include the app and all its dependencies.

item.title: Install Yay or Paru
item.description: What Are Those ? # Yay & Paru are AUR Helpers. What’s that ? Well, an AUR helper is a tool that automates the process of installing and managing packages from the Arch User Repository (AUR) on Arch Linux.

item.title: Pacman Issues
item.description: Info # This will be a short one. I noticed lately, that Pacman has been behaving badly.. I decided to attach all the videos that cover how to handle them.

item.title: PacSeek TUI
item.description: Intro # I just found a neat little tool called “Pacseek” which is a terminal user interface for searching and installing Arch Linux packages… What is it ? # Pacseek is terminal user interface, written in Rust which allows you to browse and search through the Arch Linux package databases as well as the Arch User Repository.

item.title: Terminal Aliases
item.description: A quick one today, a video by DistroTube popped up that explains shell aliases and how to create your very own.. He does it in Ubuntu but you can do the same thing in Arch…

item.title: Zoxide the smarter cd command
item.description: Intro # While browsing YouTube I stumbled upon a video showing off a neat little tool called Zoxide. It’s touted to be a smarter cd command, inspired by z and autojump.
